title: Textile, possibly 13th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: supplementary warp pile (velvet) in plain weave foundation, with continuous supplementary weft patterning
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 53 x 26 cm (20 7/8 x 10 1/4 in.)
description: Deep red velvet with offset repeat pattern of gold disks. The foundation is plain weave formed by a red silk warp and tan silk weft; the supplementary warp pile is red silk. The velvet pile is voided in the areas where the coin dots appear, and supplementary gold wefts are floated in pairs to the surface in these areas, bound in twill with the secondary ivory warp.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, possibly 13th century.
possibly 13th century. Medium: silk, metallic threads
Technique: supplementary warp pile (velvet) in plain weave foundation, with continuous supplementary weft patterning. Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-385.
